body_html:
The primary reason for this is our docker images build on top of ubuntu 14.04. We are still at this version, because our base nvidia docker images (cuda8 cudnn5) are based off of ubuntu 14.04. So we kept all our docker images at the same ubuntu version to keep consistency. Unfortunately, ubuntu 14.04 only supports up to python 3.4.

We can install python as you described, but we decided to stay with officially supported version to avoid any unprecedented issues non-offical packages may cause.

We will soon be exploring upgrading all our dockerfiles to latest ubuntu LTS version, which will allow us to upgrade python. Sorry for the inconvenience this delay may have caused.

body:
The primary reason for this is our docker images build on top of ubuntu 14.04. We are still at this version, because our base nvidia docker images (`cuda8 cudnn5`) are based off of ubuntu 14.04. So we kept all our docker images at the same ubuntu version to keep consistency. Unfortunately, ubuntu 14.04 only supports up to python 3.4.

We can install python as you described, but we decided to stay with officially supported version to avoid any unprecedented issues non-offical packages may cause. 

We will soon be exploring upgrading all our dockerfiles to latest ubuntu LTS version, which will allow us to upgrade python. Sorry for the inconvenience this delay may have caused.
